title: The Rise of AI SEO: How Artificial Intelligence Is Rewriting the Rules of Online Visibility
description: SEO is evolving faster than ever — and artificial intelligence is quietly leading the revolution. When Search Engines Started Thinking There was a time when SEO felt mechanical. title: Bank of England Warns of 'Sharp Correction' in Markets if Mood Sours on AI, Fed
description: The Bank of England warned that global markets could face sharp corrections if confidence in artificial intelligence or the U.S. Federal Reserve’s independence weakens.
content:
Global financial markets could tumble if investors' mood sours on the prospects for artificial intelligence or the independence of the U.S. Federal Reserve, the Bank of England warned on Wednesday.
The BoE said share price valuations on U.S. stock ma... [2745 chars]

title: EU wants key sectors to use made
description: The EU on Wednesday told European businesses in critical sectors to ramp up their uptake of artificial intelligence and pushed for the bloc to cut its dependence on foreign AI providers. To achieve this, the European Commission said it was mobilising one billion euros ($1.6 billion) to push key sectors like pharmaceuticals, energy and defence, to promote "European AI-powered" tools and develop specialised AI models.
content:

title: Hollywood, Bollywood groups lobby Indian panel to protect content from AI models
description: NEW DELHI (Reuters) -Hollywood and Bollywood groups are lobbying an Indian panel for stricter copyright protection that will prevent artificial intelligence firms from using their intellectual property to train AI models, letters show.
content:

title: India needs clear SATCOM and 6 GHz policies to stay competitive in AI, says IAFI chief Bharat Bhatia
description: India risks losing its technological edge in the global race for artificial intelligence (AI) and next-generation communication systems if it delays decisions on key spectrum policies, especially the 6 GHz band and non-geostationary (non-GSO) satellite communications, said Bharat Bhatia, President of the ITU-APT Foundation of India (IAFI).

title: Spain CEOs See Shortage of Skilled Labor as Hurdle for Growth
description: Spain’s skilled labor shortage is one of the biggest challenges to sustain economic growth that’s been largely led by tourism and consumption, while also attracting investments such as data centers for artificial intelligence, three of the country’s top travel and real estate CEOs said.

title: 5 ‘smart degree’ paths that lead straight to AI jobs
description: Artificial intelligence (AI) continues to reshape industries and societies worldwide, creating robust demand for professionals with expertise in AI technologies and applications. For those aspiring to enter the AI workforce, selecting a degree path that aligns well with this rapidly evolving field is crucial for success. In 2025, five key degree paths stand out as smart choices for launching a career in artificial intelligence, combining both academic rigour and industry relevance.
